event_name: The Haunted Hop | Victoria Halloween Bar Crawl
description: Get ready for the biggest Halloween Crawl in Victoria on Friday, Oct 31st. Hit the city's top bars & clubs! Date and time Fri, Oct 31, 2025 8:00 PM - Sat, Nov 1, 2025 2:00 AM PDT Location TBA TBA Victoria, BC TBA Get directions Good to know Highlights 6 hours In person Refund Policy No refunds Highlights 6 hours In person Refund Policy No refunds About this event Holiday • Halloween 🎃🕸️ VICTORIA HAUNTED HOP BAR CRAWL 2025 🕸️🎃 Get ready for the craziest Halloween celebration in Victoria. Join The Haunted Hop - Halloween Bar Crawl on Friday, October 31st, 2025 , and access to 4+ of Victoria’s hottest bars and nightclubs! 🎶 Music: Live DJs playing the hottest hits and Halloween classics. 📍 Crawl Stops: TBA—Victoria's hottest bars and nightclubs for an unforgettable Halloween celebration! 🕙 Kickoff: Doors open at 8:00 PM. Wristbands must be picked up by 10:30 PM! 🎟 Tickets: Starting at just $15. Prices go up soon, so don’t wait! Throw on your wildest costume and get ready to crawl through the city with hundreds of partygoers. Whether you're creepy, cute, or covered in fake blood—this is the crawl to be a part of on Halloween night.🧟‍♀️ ⭐ Voted Victoria’s #1 Halloween Bar Crawl Experience! Gather your ghouls and take over the city with The Haunted Hop Bar Crawl this Halloween, hitting Victoria’s top bars. 🚨 This event is limited to 500 attendees, so grab your tickets early before they sell out! Don’t miss your chance to celebrate this big holiday—secure your spot before it’s too late! VICTORIA HALLOWEEN BAR CRAWL What’s Included in Your Ticket: 🎃 Join Hundreds of Halloween Partygoers in Victoria 🚫 No Cover at All Participating Venues 🎟️ Exclusive Haunted Hop Bar Crawl Wristband for Entry 📱 Bar Crawl Map to Navigate Each Spooky Stop 🗺️ 🎵 Live DJs Spinning Halloween Hits and Party Anthems 🕺 End the Night in Style at the Final Haunted Venue 👻 Costume up and crawl your way through Victoria’s hottest bars. Enjoy eerie drink specials, electric energy, and make Halloween a night to remember! 🚨 Get Your Haunted Hop 2025 Halloween Bar Crawl Tickets Before We Sell Out! 🚨 🦇Victoria’s biggest Halloween bash is just around the corner. Costumes, cocktails, and chaos await across the city's top nightlife spots. It’s time to show off your best look and turn heads all night long. Whether you're spooky, sexy, or just straight-up wild, this Haunted Hop Halloween Bar Crawl is your chance to shine. Hit the city’s most popular bars, enjoy themed drinks, and party with hundreds of fellow Halloween lovers. Your costume deserves a crowd, and this is where to find it.

Experience the vibrant rhythms of Colombian traditional dance at the Latin Plaza Hub in Vancouver’s Gastown. This cultural workshop highlights the joy and history of dances like cumbia, mapalé, and bambuco, each blending Indigenous, African, and Spanish influences into a powerful expression of identity and celebration. Through guided steps and storytelling, participants will explore the meanings, origins, and movements behind Colombia’s most emblematic dances while connecting with the spirit of community and cultural pride.
Celebrate with live music, traditional Colombian food, lantern workshop for kids, candle lighting, and raffles.
location: 6688 Southoaks Crescent, Burnaby, BC V5E 4M7, CA

event_name: BRAVE  - a 5Rhythms® Dance Immersion with Anne Marie Hogya + Bettina Rothe
description: In this 5Rhythms® Waves and Heartbeat weekend dance | movement workshop we will explore the physical and emotional terrain of our brave. Embodiment practices, a wooden sword ritual, as well as opportunities for speaking up will be part of this empowering weekend. Together we will explore how to increase our tolerance and receptivity for bravery. When we open ourselves to new possibilities of being and relating in the world we can take one brave step at a time and see where they take us. All are welcome. No previous experience is required.
price: $365 / $325 early bird if paid by October 10th

event_name: IGNITE! A Dance Victoria Launch Party
description: Join us for the 4th annual IGNITE! A Dance Victoria Launch Party, where we'll celebrate our 29th season of the World’s Best Dance. This year, we're amping up the festivities at a new location: KWENCH, the historic Pembroke Barn Building in the heart of Victoria’s arts and design district on Store Street. This 'co-working and culture club' is airy, welcoming, and gorgeous! At IGNITE!, you’ll enjoy: An intimate duet performance by Ballet Edmonton (last seen in our 2023 co-presentation with Victoria Symphony) Tastings and cocktails curated by Phillips Brewing featuring their small batch distilled spirits Delicious savoury bites, plus sweet creations provided by Chocolat & Co. DJ LoFi, dancing, and the company of fellow arts-lovers Access to wide-ranging auction prizes in support of Dance Victoria Don't wait—we expect this party to sell out fast! All proceeds from IGNITE! and our coinciding online auction (live Oct. 9) support Dance Victoria's artist programs and community engagement activities. The party hits capacity at 180 guests so get your tickets now!

event_name: Garland of Unusual Rāgas with Arijit Mahalanabis
description: Scholar-vocalist Arijit Mahalanabis presents a specially curated Dhrupad recital featuring lesser-known rāgas, each revealing distinctive pathways of melody and emotion. Drawing from multiple traditions of Dhrupad, Khayal, and Thumri, Mahalanabis combines scholarly depth with expressive modulation, a diverse repertoire, and thoughtful improvisation. He is joined by Tejas Tope on pakhavaj, with supporting vocals from his disciples Kishan Patel and Akhil Jobanputra. This concert is part of our Baithak Series, a thematic initiative that explores esoteric aspects of Indian classical music in an engaging and accessible way. Baithaks - traditional chamber concerts - create an intimate connection between artist and audience through smaller venues with floor and chair seating. Each Baithak Series event concludes with a brief artist Q&A, offering listeners the chance to reflect on and deepen their understanding of the evening’s theme. This program is presented by the Indian Classical Music Society of Vancouver (ICMSV), with generous funding from the Vancouver Foundation's LEVEL BIPOC Grant.
location: Vancouver Unitarians, 949 West 49th, Vancouver, BC V5Z 2T1, CA
source: Indian Classical Music Society of Vancouver

Arts • Orchestra The Omega Trio is made up of three of Canada’s finest chamber musicians, who first came together as a string trio (violin, viola, cello) through a love of playing together, and a wish to play the little-heard repertoire for this combination, some of it by the most famous composers. Named after a now-defunct garage for repairing French cars in Vancouver (don’t ask), they have performed in unusual spaces, including dilapidated private homes, luxurious mansions, cathedrals and small churches, as well as in traditional concert venues. Their repertoire comprises music from the 18th century to the present day, including masterworks by Schubert, Beethoven and Schnittke.
